user_review: Came here last year around February for a long weekend trip to Montreal. I was looking for a quick breakfast and coffee spot to start the day, stumbled upon this spot on Instagram as a recommendation.The front of the cafe was so unique, big marble door steps that lead up to the entrance. Walking in, I was really impressed by the decor here. There's alot of very gothic designs painted in white and plants hanging everywhere, so pretty! My friend and I each got a coffee and a pastry. I got the chocolate scone and she got the almond croissant. For drinks, we each got a specialty drink.The food- the scone was really yummy, with dark chocolate so not overwhelmingly sweet. The croissant was very soft and covered with plenty of almonds. I like that they give the food to you on a cute green and white checkered piece of paper and served on a white porcelain plate.The coffees- these were so beautiful and yummy, they look like they could be hung up as art. I love places that give you a little design on your coffee foam, mine had a very pretty heart on it! I also like that you can see the layers of the coffee. The coffee shop is pretty crowded so I would recommend scoping out for a seat as soon as you walk in, but the food and coffee here is great!!

Tommy Café has always been a favourite of mine! I absolutey love that they are opened again :) their service is great and their places are aaalways super cute! We got mimosas and the Truffle Omelette and it was divine :) I also got their prociutto grilled cheese in the past and its also a great pick :) I really like the ambiance, chill music, open windows and the oldmport view! Definitely stop by if you are around :D

The lovely cafe shop right around the corner in the heart of Montreal! It is so cute to plants all around the cafe like this. After a walk around town in the summer, I was thirsty and found this place. So beautiful. Besides coffee, they also serve croissants and pastries. Every corner is absolutely clean and organized. There are books if you go by yourself and want to have some quiet time. There are a few water stations around the place for customers who want to grab a sip of water with their coffees. Small flower vases are found throughout the store. If I were a resident in this city, this cafe will absolutely be my favorite place to go to!Highlights of the menu:1. Matcha latte2. Hot chocolate

February 20, 2019 - this please is very cute, the staff was friendly. It does get very very hot in there. Maybe it was just me. We ordered:Breakfast croissantChocolate danishAlmond danishSomething like a donut (sorry don't know the name) Classic avotoast w/ prosciuttoClassic avotoast w/ salmon And a few drinksWe sat on the second floor it's such a pretty little brunch spot. Definitely recommend. But we didn't stay too long as we all started to feel too hot.

Friendly barista,Decent menu, had an avocado toast, a little over priced but good none the less.  Always a long line up, really nice decor, tons of plants and cute Knick knacks around the cafe. Not a crazy amount of seating at this location but we found there a quick turn over. This location gets lots of sun light which is really nice.

Wow so glad I tried this on our last morning in Montreal. We were looking for a place in the Old Port area that had traditional Montreal style bagels. This little cafe is adorable with lots of plants windows and a full coffee bar. We came during on a Sunday morning and had no issue finding a seat. There were a couple of things on the menu that appealed (avocado toast, salad) but I opted for the lox bagel and drip coffee.This was phenomenal and may even be the best lox I've had. The bagel was thinner a bit crispier and overall more flavorful than those in the US. I loved that it came deconstructed so I could add ingredients as I needed. I am not sure what was in the cream cheese, but it was very thin,  light and overall delicious; it almost tasted like creme fraiche. The capers, thin slices of salmon and pickled onions were just perfect complements to the  each other. I left feeling completely satisfied and not overstuffed. Between the food and nice atmosphere, I wish I had discovered this place sooner.

For some reason I had high expectations for this establishment just because I heard that it gets crazy busy here. I am hovering between 3 to 4 stars. First to make it clear, this location is order and then get seated type of cafe, whereas the one further down the street is sit down and get waited on cafe. The difference is that the other one opens an hour later than this location, which we had no idea. We came here around 9am on a Sunday and the lines weren't long at all (at the top of the steps) and there were still some seating available. It is pretty tiny in here and will get claustrophobic - I do not know how one maneuvers through here during peak hours. It was not even busy and it was hard to move around already. The menu did not pique my interest, but for the sake of it, I ordered the avocado toast.I have got to say that this was one of the best avocado toasts I've ever had! This is worth ordering, especially with that egg on top. I ordered a cappuccino as well. Apparently you are supposed to grab the drinks first and then find a seat - it does not come with your meal when the staff brings over the food for you. Because of this, our drinks got cold and the staff was friendly enough to offer us a second cup before we left. The coffee is pretty strong, which is why this place deserves a 4 star. It is so rare for me to get wired like the way I did with this cappuccino. Highly recommend.Overall, this is a cute cafe but certainly not the most relaxing. Almost felt claustrophobic. If I come back to Montreal, I definitely want to try the other location so I can sit down and enjoy my meal. I believe they have a more extensive menu. If I am in a rush, I'd come back here to get a nice cup of cappuccino to wake sleepy me up.

Montreal has some of the most beautiful cafes in the world and Tommy is definitely up there when it comes to aesthetics. From the beautiful collection of plants to the classic crown moulding to the irregular furniture, everything works together to create a hip and cozy space. It is here at Tommy where I first tried the glorious, deep fried, artery-clogging CRONUT. SooOoooOOoOo good. (One star off because everything is slightly overpriced)

Tommy Cafe is a beautiful three-level cafe in a corner historic building in the heart of Old Montreal. It's very popular so many people get their food to go, but if you can snag a table or couch, it's worth to dine in. The hanging plants and natural light create a peaceful environment. The menu itself is small compared to other nearby cafes. They have coffee, pastries, a few cocktails, and avo toast (they give you an option to add an egg).I ordered their "Summer 19" cocktail. If you like sweeter, light cocktails, get it. I felt so refreshed afterwards.My nutella cronut was the first cronut I enjoyed. My avo toast was big and came with a side green salad. It was a simple avo toast and good, but not worth the price.If you pick cafes based on looks, this one is very good-looking.

The decor of my dreams, a delicious hot creamy latte, and curled up on a cold day with a dear friend.. Perfect place to spend any afternoon or morning. Didn't get a chance to try the food, but the coffee here was delicious.

Wow this place is great! The atmosphere here is the first thing that drew me in. Very white and clean, with brown wood tones and plants everywhere. A very unique mixture of modern and old fashioned that works super well. The second thing about this place I noticed were the very friendly and smiley staff. They were very nice and I didn't feel rushed whatsoever. They answered my questions politely and patiently. They also spoke great English!I got the oat milk chai latte and my wife got the vanilla latte--both were excellent, I just wished my chai latte was less sweet. I personally like them unsweetened and this one is definitely not that. However, I do love that they have several non-dairy milk options.My only comment would be I come to coffee shops more to work than relax, so I'd love more outlets. There were not many available at all. But if you come here for pleasure, you'll love it.

Please read this 4 review as more of a 3.5. Tommy's pastries are pretty incredible, and it's got an adorable plant-filled aesthetic that I love, but I can NEVER get a seat in here.There are so many other cafés nearby that also never have seating because people camp out all day with their laptops! I wish that there was a rule about this because it really ruins a good café.

One of the classic instagram cafes of Montreal. Located near Crew cafe, this cafe is much much smaller so expect to wait a bit to find a seat if you decide to go during peak times/a sunny day. This isn't really the kind of cafe that I like to go to when I want to study because it is quite crowded all the time and they don't have many tables near plugs to charge your electronics. The pastries are really good, I got the nutella doughnut and it was delicious. The drinks are quite ordinary.

A friend from Old Port recommended this spot and I'm so glad she did! I fell in love with the interior, food and service!! I looked up on Yelp to decide what to order based on the reviews. Ended up getting a Mimosa and the Greek Avocado Bread. It was a great decision!! The taste of the Avocado & Bread, Chilli Flakes, Salt, Cheese, Onions, Cherry Tomatoes and lime worked so well together!! I am really excited and happy to have found this spot and will return very soon!! Would definitely recommend if in the area, otherwise make the trip to Tommy because it's definitely worth it!

This place is the best. Summer in Montreal is a muddy humid mess, so to my surprise that I found this cool cafe where I can get a nice cup of Joe and cool myself off. Located near the Notre-Dame cathedral, this cafe is absolutely relaxing indoors, even with the continuous crowds that pass on through. They had WiFi, outlets, air conditioner, and seating for you to people watch as they walk by. I ordered myself an iced mocha and it comes in their signature metal mugs. I'm clumsy. Yes, I was nervous carrying my drink up the stairs, but if I can manage then you'll manage as well. I will stop by again in the future if I'm ever in the area. Thanks Tommy for the recharge and the cool down with the aircon.
Amazing avocado toast, the feta cheese and the salmon just compliments the whole taste. It's amazing
Super cute pit stop on the way to roam the town...very cozy and great pastries...only downfall is limited seating because nobody wants to leave! Loved it here!!!

The food was amazing at this small cafe. We ordered the lox bagel, grilled cheese, an Americanism and latte. The food was 10/10. Something I've noticed in Montreal is the staff at restaurants are a little arrogant to tourists, mainly if don't speak French. The reason I'm giving a 4-star review is that they seemed a little annoyed we asked for condiments with our meal, and because we were tourists. It sucks when the experience is ruined by staff that are not overly friendly.

I think most of Tommy's patrons come there for one of a few reasons. I came for the coffee and for Instagramming the plants on the ceiling as well as the building: I love the style, it reminds me of a newspaper building from an old-fashioned movie! The interior is also extremely cute--there's tall, winding steps in the center, more plants that aren't just hanging from the towering ceiling, bright and open space with lots of windows, and large mirrors that make the space look huge. I walked up the steps to check how big the space was and realized it was an illusion and felt a tad bit silly. Oh well!This is located kind-of near Chinatown, and I made the trek in the snow from the Theatre St. James to order the matcha latte and a Nutella cronut. The cronut was baked to perfection and had just the right balance of Nutella and butter. Come for the food and the 'gram.

Reall cool cafe. Their Nutella donuts are insanely good. Their mocha coffee is amazing as well and so is their hot chocolate. They have a few locations in old Montreal. Definitely a spot to warm up and get some coffee or tea.

Come here at around 3pm and there are already a lot of people, even on the weekdays. But the environment is not so noisy, and with the charger and free wifi, it's definitely a good place for work and study.I ordered the chai latte with almond milk and it's really good. But the food is not what i want since it's cold and hard. One coffee and one food cost me around $10, which i think it a little overpriced according to its taste. Maybe i should try another kind of food next time:)

We were looking for a cool Café to spend a few hours and we came across this place in old Montréal. We tried the hot chocolate and the latte, both good! The great point is that unlike franchises here you don't get paper cups. Old fashioned durable glass cups instead!On a cold winter Sunday, parking was easy. We waited few minutes to have a free table though! Prices were fair, staff polite, ambiance nice.

Get coffee here. The ambience is beautiful! This cafe is such a nice space to do work or hangout with friends. It's very open with beautiful architecture on the inside. The coffee and drinks are very delicious. That is definitely worth your money.For breakfast food, the avocado toast with tomato was 10$, a bit steep for what it is. The breakfast sandwich was also around that price. The food was good, but probably not worth paying that much.

Omgggg such a CUTE place I love the chill atmosphere and the gorgeous plants they had all over the place !! It's super comfortable but the only downside is that it got filled up pretty quickly so I would recommend going early. I got a hit chocolate made with oat milk and it was really good and they made a little cute art on the top which I loveeee considering I'm a barista myself too!! My friend got a chai latte which was gorgeous and she told me it tasted good !! I didn't get the food unfortunately but they all looked super tasty :) the workers there are super nice too and they were helpful when I asked a couple of questions since it was my first time there !! Their menu isn't too extensive so u don't have to think a lot ahaha anyways I really recommend this place if you're looking for a quiet place to do your work or just hang out with your friends !!!!

Cute, crowded and busy.Nice old architecture, a lot of white paint, plants and beautiful big old windows with unique multi-level seating.I particularly like the retro living room decor that has a table containing old encyclopedias with a Virgin Mary and a globe on top.I couldn't help notice they allow dogs and I think that is terrific.  I wish more places would do the same.Husband had the pecan tart and swears it's the best he's ever had.  We also bought some chocolate croissants that were excellent.Oh, I almost forgot, their coffee is wonderful!

This is my first time at the original location for Tommy. It has a French allure to it-with fresh greens, flowers and a glass pastry display. I came here after work around 6 pm. The café is a split level with three floors. You won't have trouble finding a space go sit but good luck if you want to plug in your laptop. Most of the outlets are located in the upper floor. I thought the mix and match furniture was creative but the sofas on the top floor looked run down - not very clean. There are two bathroom with very poor lighting and a common washing area.I paid 13$ for a croissant and a fresh pineapple coconut  juice. It was refreshing but not for its 8$ price. My croissant was stale, which makes senses if it's out in the open. Overall, I think I would come back here for the change of work environment for that once in a while as it is in the heart of old Montreal. It's nice to be a tourist in your own city. I prefer the second location on St. Paul.

This place has been on my list for months. I finally got a chance to visit this cute cafe in the old port. The entrance is beautiful. The cafe is 2 floors with stunning architecture and designs in white spectrum along with plants everywhere. I loved the decor of this cafe. However, it's very compact with tables, chairs and couches; almost claustrophobic. They do have free wifi. They also have water in beautiful bottles with glasses sitting in corners of the place. This isn't a quiet cafe, if that's what you're looking for. It's a good place to have group meetings and socialize. I ordered a ice coffee and a grilled cheese sandwich which came up to $17. It's a little high in price but this is the old port. You grab a table number and find a table. One of the servers will bring the food to you. I this it's cute because in the meantime you're getting comfortable wherever you are sitting. I loved my salad, the dressing was great. There are other baked goodies, doughnuts and food you can order. I really liked this place and would definitely go again.

Ugh... Instagram made me!!Had this café on my bucket list for ages after seeing all the attractive pictures all over Instagram. Being a sucker for gorgeous interiors, especially old/historic buildings converted into modern coffee shops, Tommy was at the top of my list. From a distance, the coffee shop stands out with its stunning corner-elevation of beautiful Victorian Architecture. However, I was a little disappointed upon entering. The space is much smaller than I anticipated and a lot of seating has been crammed into this space. I do love the play of levels with mezzanines which works well and appreciate the relaxed atmosphere however, being popular with both tourists and locals, it can get really claustrophobic waiting in such a small space. Consider yourself extremely lucky if you get a seat during weekends/peak times as people don't seem to want to move from there.The décor definitely is one of its main features for those picture-perfect Instagram shots as the café is bright and flooded with natural light. The hanging foliage, chandelier and ornate mouldings on the ceiling and walls create the ideal dream backdrop. It is a shame therefore that I cannot say the same for the coffee/snacks. I had the honey-glazed mushroom and goat cheese toast with a mocha and the raved-about 'cronut' which were all disappointing and extremely over-priced. It cost around 25$ for the 3 items - none of which were worth it.Overall, a stunning café worth visiting for the pictures but for a bite, there are plenty of better options in the area where you are sure to get more than a meagre $14 toast.

One of my favorite cafes. And I love frequenting cafes. When you walk up the stairs and into the space, you instantly notice the large "chandelier" of hanging planters coming down from the two-story cafe. If you love greenery like me, you'll love this place. It's a loft-space with a first floor, a "mid-floor" space with seating and a second floor with seating and bathrooms. They serve all your usual espresso and cafe drinks, brunch items (get the avo toast with lox/prosciutto!), and bakery items (try the cronut!!). Also worth noting; this review is just for this location. I've been to their new location in the midst of Old Montreal and the setup is not nearly as good and it's far too packed.

LOVE this place. They have so many live plants and cute decorations that makes this place unique also blended in this little French city. The mirror definitely makes this place twice bigger than it is. I was pleased to know that they have many kinds of alternative non-diary milk to choose from. The chai latte that I got was pretty good. They also have bagels that seems to be a popular item on the menu. One block away, there is another tommy has more options also serves regular meals. This one focuses more on light meals and drinks. They also offer WiFi which was a huge plus! I don't have any data when I travel, so I utilize WiFi whenever I can. I enjoyed this place and highly recommend to anyone who is in this city to check it out.

This is a charming outpost! The coffee was great. The avocado toast with egg was delicious. The almond croissant was delicious as well. Communal bottles of water are stationed in different parts of the place. Very charming.

A good breakfast place! A little on the pricey side. We spent about $30 on 2 toasts and a latte. I ordered the sweet toast with glazed peaches, goat cheese, and honey and my husband ordered the more savory avocado toast. Heads up, you have to pay extra for any other toppings other than avocado.The location we went to was pretty small. It was a little difficult to find a table but we did manage to snag one after waiting for some people to leave. But most people there had their laptops and looked like they were planning on spending all day there.My toast was good but I was still pretty hungry after. I don't think it was worth the price. It was unique, though. A popular item on the menu that we saw everyone else order was the croissant breakfast sandwich with egg and other toppings. It looked very filling so I think that should be the item to order if you come visit!

This is a really great spot in old Montreal for coffee, brunch, desserts, or just if you want to chill. Situated right near the Notre Dame is Tommy - a cool, hip  cafe with soaring ceilings and very aesthetic plants. They have a small menu but they'll definitely be something for everyone - from their kronut to their avocado toasts to their ice lattes - you'll definitely find something you enjoy. If you're in a hurry you can get takeout, but it's a really nice atmosphere to sit in. I've been multiple times and have had various things - but their baked goods are quite good I have to say. This is one of that fewer places which has matcha lattes in Montreal (matcha presence is slowly growing), so I had to get an iced matcha latte here. I also tried the brioche and kronut...The latte was not overly sweet and good quality matcha...and the brioche was very tasty! I'd definitely recommend this cafe when visiting old Montreal!

What a fabulous little café! Really gorgeous refurbishment of a beautiful old building - what is it? A former bank? The foliate woodwork around the ceiling is accented by a massive chandelier of leafy vine plants hanging over the main interior. Multiple levels give you plenty of gawk-space for people watching, and people-watching you will do! Excellent vintage blues playlist and delicious espresso. Tattooed beauties of all genders are the prominent feature amongst the clientele. Also, can it get more hipster than AVOCADO TOAST? Seriously, though, we were super happy to find this spot, open early, right in the heart of Vieux Montreal. Revved on a double shot, I'm inspired to go get more ink, like, today!

The breakfast croissant was amazing. We took it to go because we had to head on the road but it was worth the pit stop. The warm prosciutto in it really hit the spot. The guy at the counter was nice enough to direct us to the English menu when he heard us speaking English and looking for the breakfast croissant.
Excellent cappuccinos in a gorgeous building. The food looks off the hook! I'll definitely be back when in Montreal.PS - seating will be hard to find at lunch time!

Stopped here for fuel to get our day started! Great espresso & solid breakfast croissant. Loooooved the texture of the croissant - right amount of flakiness, crunch, and buttery goodness. Cappuccino & lattes were well crafted.  Most of all was blown away by the interior & vibes. Great way to start the day!

It's just an old tri-level coffee shop with stale croissants. Old furniture and over-priced drinks because you're in the tourist trap area.Trying to be a trendy shabby chique cafe., when it's simply dirty and out of date.As a seasoned world traveller...not recommended.
The cutest little spot! Had the best avocado toast and took some really cute pix! Coffee was so great I visited this place twice during my holiday

Reasonably priced good strong coffee, fresh juices, delicious pastries, lovely interior. Front staffs are nice too. Only downside is that they don't serve hot drinks in a mug, they serve it in a round glass cup so better watch your fingers when you grab them!

There are 2 locations of Tommy. Both are near the Notre-Dame Cathedral. I had breakfast at both places on separate days. They're really busy which shows how good the food is. I had the best cappuccino's both times. The food was phenomenal, the staff were attentive, & cool ambiance. I really enjoyed both experiences here & I highly recommend checking out both restaurants for breakfast.
Sorry ;) SUPER-overrated but hey it's cool anyway check it out ... coffee was alright and croissants not bad. love the decor and plants

I was looking for a good breakfast place when I was in Montreal. This is definitely one of my favourites!I usually don't eat a lot for breakfast. A cup of coffee or tea, and a little snack will do.According to the reviews, the 'cado toast is definitely something you need to order. So I did just that! I had a chai latte and brought it to my seat. The chai latte was pretty good. I liked the cinnamon on top. A few minutes later, the avocado toast graced my table. It was bigger than i thought, which was great! Considering you can get a smaller piece of avocado toast in Toronto for the same price (or even more!), this was a steal. My plate was taken up by most of the toast. It had sesame seeds that provided a little crunch and texture. The bread was soft but toasted. The avocado was creamy and fresh. The flavour was extraordinary. Listen, you can make a really crappy avocado toast or a really good one. This was the best. The crushed red pepper flakes and the salt made it perfect. The lemon wedges and rosemary (?) on the side was delicious. The lemon cut the creaminess. And the olive oil brought out the creaminess in the avocado. The service was delightful. The atmosphere was amazing! High ceilings, rustic furniture, sofas, many designated seating areas, and plants + flowers made it a great experience. Truly relaxing.

I gave the ambiance, location and friendly staff(usually the case in Canada though) 5 stars and then deducted 2 stars for the "not worth it prices". The cappuccino and grilled cheese sandwich costed me $18+ with gratuity and there was nothing special about any of it. I would still come for the ambiance/ lovely French decor and interesting seating arrangements and may be another coffee?

Came here for brunch. They ran out of croissants after our group ordered 4 breakfast croissant sandwiches and notified us of the issue 15 minutes after ordering. 10 minutes later the server came back and told us more croissants just arrived, so we all ended up getting the croissants (instead of a bagel substitute). We waited a total of maybe ~30-40 minutes for our food. Nevertheless the sandwich itself was delicious and they were very accommodating with food substitutions. Tre vegan maple cake is delicious!The interior of the café is really cute and instagram-able, and the servers were friendly/very apologetic even though the shortage of croissants was not their fault!

Super quaint and cute cafe! The lattes and americanos here are very good and they have pastries to boot. The upstairs was full so we sat by the window, it was a cold day and it was nice to see the outside world from the inside! The ambiance is really country cute and is a very polite and sweet vibe. Sorta reminds me of playing "tea time" when you were a kid. I thought it was very cute, and it is a quiet coffee shop. The pastries were flaky and very tasty and the staff was very polite. I enjoy the coffee mugs they give you as well and I think this is up there in coffee shops in Montreal. I would certainly make a stop here! In a great location of old town too!

Came here on a Friday morning around 11am. It was quite busy and difficult to find a table but we were able to seat ourselves. I can't imagine how busy it is on the actual weekend. The ambiance here is adorable and really the high point. Lush greenery with vines hanging from all over the ceiling, as the yelp gallery suggests. I will say the music is all over the place, from mellow hiphop to pop to just flat out locally-sourced Cirque du Soleil soundtrack. *Bagel with salmon, cream cheese: This was presented in a "deconstructed" manner which was beautiful. I should've asked them if they got their bagels from St-Viateur or from Fairmont (or maybe neither?), but either way the bagel was top notch classic Montreal style. Good amount of fixins (capers, lox and cream cheese). *Almond croissant: Light, doughy on the inside yet crispy on the outside, perfectly baked.Located just down the street from Notre-Dame Cathedral, this place is an ideal stop to include while wandering Old Montreal, and just soak up the vibe of this vibrant cultured city. And if you're an Instagrammer or an avocado-toast junkie, this is definitely the place for you.

I planned on spending the day in Old Town, so Cafe Tommy was a convenient and photogenic spot for a quick breakfast before a busy day.I ordered a Croissant déjeuner and a soy cappuccino. The croissant was light, crispy and flaky, and the egg was cooked perfectly over medium. The cap was so-so but helped me recover from mild jet lag.Solid spot!
Beautiful building , and very nice presentation!  The food was very good but a bit overpriced in my opinion.

I was looking to try a a new place for a while. Looked at the reviews and it looked really good... the thing is that I was not going to Tommy's with any expectations but still got a little disappointed. I'm giving 3/5 mainly because of the venue and the fresh ingredients, but not for the quality of the food. Everything was really blend. It felt like the chef was cooking while having a cold. I had the avocado toast, salad of the day and the pear-fecto juice. The toast was really blend. I mean, avocados itself is delicious. But when you do an avocado toast, you need a little flavour balance. Which was not there in this case. The salad was like the chef just mixed the ingredients with a little bit of oil and that was it. No salt, no lemon or vinaigrette. I mean, it's a salad, how complicated can it be. For the juice, it was good, freshly juiced. So nothing to say on that one :) So... overall. You want a beautiful venue to take beautiful photos. You got it. You want a place to be impressed by the food. Do not go there.

I saw that in 2016, Vogue recommended this cafe to be one of the best places to get coffee in Montréal. I will first admit.. I forgot to get coffee! I was entranced by the chai latte instead and ordered that. I had promised myself to come back for a second round simply to try their coffee, but I didn't have the time unfortunately. I will say that the chai latte I had was really tasty, which I find sometimes chai lattes lack, even though the spice should be a standout in the drink. I also ordered a grilled cheese, which I chose as a result of someone else's review. Hands down one of the best grilled cheese sandwiches I've ever purchased. I should've asked what cheese they used and what they put on their bread, because damn. It was good. It was a bit crunchy, which personally I liked, and the cheese was thick and filled the sandwich. To be honest, however, it's Tommy's aesthetic that got me. The care looks like the inside of someone's brownstone in NYC, white with a staircase and all sorts of decor. There's a variety of furniture for desk and seating spaces. I even sat between a candy machine and a bookshelf, there are also outlets if you could spot them. It is a really great place to work, seeing that half of those inside were on laptops, typing away. The natural light is also really lovely, and there are bathrooms, which is always a plus in my book. I really wish I could return, and bring my camera to snap more shots of the beautiful interior. I'll end with a shoutout to the staff here, who switch flawlessly between french and english for customers while remaining attentive and kind. Will I return? I hope so.

They have soymilk and make an awesome iced coffee (cafe glace with le lait soja).Fun seating with lots of space and light.The only problem I had in Montreal was wanting to eat everywhere twice!  Tommy's is no exception.  I want to come back to try the avocado toast.

If there's a more innovative bathroom in Montreal, I haven't found it. Tucked into the back corner of the cafe's top floor, this bathroom offers a unique open air layout, with its sink and mirror available to all. There are two private toilettes offering cramped quarters. Though I was unhappy to see an advertisement thrust in my face upon closing the door, I suppose it should come as no surprise in the post industrialised neoliberal society we live in. The rest of my toilette experience was fine - the ambient light, beautiful moulding, and antique lantern were excellent touches. I suppose that shy bathroom goers might find the public sink experience a bit daunting, but I give this bathroom extra points for its audacity! The message is clear - one needn't feel shame for using the restroom/commode. The worst part of this bathroom is simply its accessibility, or lack thereof. It can only be reached by walking up two (small) flights of stairs. In a multilevel cafe, it's preferable to have its restroom on the first floor. Still, 5/5 stars for cleanliness, space efficiency, and ambiance! If you need a bathroom near Port, Tommy's is the place to be.

The café is beautiful, I won't belabor that point any further.The cons, for me:- Seating. If you don't want a seat with your food and coffee, great. If you do, get those elbows ready! - Other patrons. Clearly people needed seats and yet a lot of people had their sh*t in seats next to them. ...good to know you think your purse and coat are more tired and deserving than your fellow (wo)man. More dick-ish than DC even and that's saying something.- Pastries were okay, but not great.- The drink I ordered was really small, especially for the quality and price.- The music. I liked it, but it was a bit schizophrenic volume-wise and genre-wise. Suddenly it was twice as loud and some pseudo-angry Germany-esque screamy song. My only guess was that maybe it was some sort of clearing technique to get the "been here 5 hours and counting" crowd to clear out and make room for more patrons with more money to spend?Not sure I'd come back...now that I've gotten my IG picture. ;)
Such a cute place to sit and hangout with your friends and the coffee is good too. Got a much needed iced latte to drink on a very hot day in Montreal. The latte was so smooth.

Stunning decor. Stellar service. Excellent food (except for the almond croissant which was tasteless and limp, but hey, no one is perfect.) The avocado toast was so worth it! Supported by excellent bread toasted to maintain crispiness despite the slathering of avocado spread, tomatoes and olive oil. Mmmm. It's two hours before closing (at 8pm daily) on a national holiday so they were sold out of everything else, so we will definitely have to come back and try more things!

Stopped here before checking out of our hotel down the street. Got a latte and avocado toast. Both were fantastic. The shop is super trendy and beautifully decorated, it was fun to sit and eat the meal if only for a few minutes!
super cute place within Old Montreal. the ambience was nice and it was aesthetically pleasing. many non dairy milk options which was much appreciated. my oat milk cappuccino was solid.

The atmosphere and decor in this cafe is just beautiful ! it's such a great blend of modern and old elegance in the way the architecture is presented and utilized. The location is in the heart of old montreal not far from the old port and walking distance from the metro. I've come here on a few occasions usually more in search of coffee rather than food. Their coffee is excellent , I really enjoy their oat milk cappuccino and their matcha latte , definitely worth the price. I also tried their booster shot with ginger and cayenne , it was fresh tasty and energizing ! the last time I came by I finally tried the food , I had avocado toast with smoked salmon and my friend had avocado toast with an egg. The quality was good , a good amount of smoked salmon and generous portion of avocado on a thick piece of bread with olive oil and spices. It was enjoyable and everything was very fresh but I agree with the reviews below upwards of 10$ is a tad steep for it. they also had a variety of pastries available as well as salad options and breakfast sandwich options.Great place for a coffee date. I'm not sure this would be my first choice of place for food but I am certainly coming back for their coffee , booster shots,  pastries and for the lovely decor and energetic yet laid back atmosphere.
My favorite meal in all my time in Montréal was this avocado toast. Wow! The espresso is delicious and the atmosphere was wonderful. Go there and go there again. I will!

Tommy Cafe will earn my 5th star if it was less crowded, and had more items on the menu that I become obsessed about. That's not necessarily a bad thing, but it would def enhance the experience. Simply put, it is a b e a u t i f u l duplex cafe with gorgeous plants and retro decor. There are a variety of couches and side tables, tables and chairs, and step seating. Their lattes are great, and there are two menu items I came for twice in the single week I was visiting Montreal - (1) avocado toast and (2) salmon bagel. Sounds simple, but to do it great - maybe in Montreal, and maybe at Tommy. The avocado toast appears simple with red pepper flakes, lemon, salt and mashed avocado over toast, but it is complex in the bread. Perfectly toasted bread with sesame seeds on the side - enhances the flavor of the avo toast by a world difference. The salmon bagel was also amazing. I don't usually like to eat cream cheese, but I was not at all distracted by it because it wasn't drowned in cream cheese. The bagel itself is soft and fluffy, the smoked salmon is tasty and the addition of the red onion really helps cut the after-flavor of eating too much smoked salmon. Highly recommend!

In love! I'd like to transplant this local Montreal coffee shop and bring it back to NY with me.A co-worker and I walked in and immediately see a million delicious pastries to our left, and two our right two levels of seating and ceilings draped with lush green plants. The menu had a good list of coffees, teas and fresh squeezed juices (I ordered the pear juice and when I saw it I felt like I was at a tiki bar!) We ordered drinks and avocado toasts (+egg and prosciutto) and took our number up to a table. The first floor was all mirrored walls, making the space feel like it went on for infinity, but it's actually pretty small. The tables and seating was all mismatched going for a cool found objects kind of theme. On the upper floor we were able to claim the corner with mismatched couches and an antique coffee table. Our food was brought up to us by their super friendly staff and we enjoyed a quick breakfast here before making our way on for the day!
Nice cute place right next to the Notre Dame with excellent breakfast and well laid out. Would definitely recommend the avocado toast with everything on it

I liked Tommy, and would definitely put it up there amongst the best cafes in the "tourist" area of Old Port. I unfortunately can't say I "loved it" from a menu perspective, even though i LOVE avo toast. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area, but not worth the trek across town. The Pro's are similar to what everyone's saying: decoration (even was a bit decked out for the holidays!), pastries, delicious lattes! Once you order, service is pretty quick!However, my experience there was sub par...I went on a Saturday morning, and the line was massive! I think they could use an extra cash or a new ordering system. There were many empty tables available. Prices for toasts were as follows:*$9 for a plain avo toast, extra for tomato, egg ...*$11-$15 for goat cheese, mushroom etc toastsPersonally, I find this to be fairly overpriced. I was expecting a beautiful plating or a heaping portion, but it was rather "basic" in my opinion.

Only come for the greenery. The staff are incompetent and has a shitty attitude. Ordered an ice tea and after ten minutes of waiting with no other customers and the girls behind the bar all on their phones, we inquired if our drink was being made? They girls all rolled their eyes and poured the pre-made Hawaiian punch looking add jug into a cup and pushed the cup across while sucking jet teeth. Fucking horrible.

Great little old place; great ambiance. Vibes are very homey and hipster but it is very small so there is limited seating, but that what's makes the place more cozy. Also a good place to study or get coffee with a 2/3 friends. Excellent food and great portions. The Greek avocado toast was delicious and all the ingredients where very fresh. The Brooklyn bagel was also very delicious and came with a small side salad. Chai latte was amazing, very sweet and not too strong. Detox shots - good. The pearfecto was ok, nothing special. MUST TRY THE CRONUTS. Like wow!!!!!!!! That Nutella was scrumptious and I couldn't eat 7 more.

Very cute and trendy spot with delicious food. They were out of a lot of things when I went so I'd call before to make sure they have what you want. Not many options for food but they had what I was looking for, avo toast! Very delicious piece of toast and I have to say, the bread was super good! I got the Greek avo toast and it was fantastic!!
Yummy food, good coffee, cutest cafe I've ever been in. The staff was SUPER friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend just to stop by, you won't be disappointed.

This is a great little coffee house in the heart of the Old Montreal district. Even though there seems to be lots of seating, the place was pretty busy, but me and a couple friends were lucky to find a few stools by the window, which is the perfect spot for people watching as you enjoy your coffee.I had an Americano coffee, which was bold and had great flavor. I paired that with one of their pastries, which looked like a small cinnamon roll, but was more flaky and brittle than what I expected. File this one under, it looked better than it tasted. For anyone visiting the city, this is a great place to take a break and enjoy some of the local culture before heading back out to see the sites.

Concerning the breakfast, its a kind of "café", if you are a type like me that love to have eggs, bacon and those regular breakfast stuff, skip here, as the maximum of eggs that you can get is an egg into your croissant or toast that already is costing you 10$ for it.Place is beautiful but I love here for happy hours, got really disappointed for the breakfast... :(((Cost us over 46$ for a breakfast with only 2 toasts, a cronut, a danoise, one juice and 2 coffees!!! Service was slow and they even forgot to prepare for our coffee, they also never got us any napkins or utensils

I would not recommend this restaurant.  The service was poor, the servers could care less, and food was totally lacking.  I had a very feeble attempt at Eggs Benedict and must say it was nothing to write home about.  The Hollandaise sauce was bland and the entire brunch was unremarkable.

This was the worst experience we had in old Montreal. Waited 25 mins for a cold bagel with cream cheese and a smoked meat bagel. Would not recommend this place to anyone! Oh yeah the coffee was just okay! Boo to Tommy's

A cute place with large mirrors and high ceilings. Order up front and they find you in this two story cafe. One of the cutest places to have your breakfast and coffee, but expect drinks and food to be average.

Stumbled upon this Beauty while strolling through Old Town. The architecture of this old building is magnificent. The seating is Awesome inside and we scored a window seat with a table . Unfortunately their kitchen was closed so I ordered a beer. It was perfect temp and poured in to a nice glass.....The espresso machine looks impressive so I am sure their coffee drinks are tasty. Nothing beats the view of this place. People watching perfection. And an unbeatable corner view of some beautiful old structures. Take a load off and go in to Tommy Montreal ( Notre Dam location). I will be coming back for a pastry next time I am in Montreal....LOVED!

Overrated tourist trap. Had to send back almond croissant because it was extremely hard. The second one was better but not fresh. Good chai latte but a bit pricey and very limited seating. Most people there were on their laptops forever so it was hard to find seating for three. Avocado toast was very small and tasteless. There are better places nearby for coffee. Seems like a place people go to work. Won't go back.

Tommy was one of the cafes that was suggested to me by my cousin. She had visited this cafe when she was in Montreal and boy was it a good suggestion. It is a very beautiful cafe with 2 floors and greenery everywhere. Absolutely delicious coffee and food here too.Mum got the nutella donut and I had the avocado toast. She had been on a cappuccino spree since we got to Montreal so that's what she had ordered. I got the matcha latte with the pretty leaf design on the middle. Food and drinks were very good. I loved how they add the chili pepper flakes on the avocado toast. It was filling and added good heat to a wonderful toast. Sad that we couldn't sit more in the cafe because there were not enough spots on the 2nd floor. But we got some cute seats by the window which was nice. The cafe is conveniently located a block away from the Basilica of Montreal. Since this area is a popular tourist spot, the cafe can be popping here too.
Beautiful spot! I had avocado toast which was decent, but worth it to go for the experience. I could hang out there and read all day.
What a gem! Chic decor and amazing atmosphere! The chocolate croissant and avotoast are must try!

Very cute little café and I use the word "little" in a literal term. It's quite a small place. Atmosphere is nice and welcoming. A little pricey in my opinion, but the coffee and moka were good and the avocado toast with salmon was delicious(my toast was a little more crispier than I like) but never the less it was good! The place fills up very fast so I suggest you go there early and get a seat! Its close to the old port,so I would defiantly suggest checking it out instead of your average Starbucks!
Tommy was good. Staff is helpful, coffee and doughnuts were good enough though the place is a bit crowded and no seat to sit. Anyway good location in an historic corner building!

I am madly in love with our Montréal's cafés. Tommy is another one to get on my favorite list of cafes. It's situated in the heart of old Montreal. From outside, the place seems humongous, but when you are inside, it's a two floor café, and it occupies 1/4 of the building. The decor inside is absolutely lovely. It feels you are in the tropical, with plants, pineapple as decors. The place is very well illuminated by the natural light coming through the big windows. The color scheme (principal ones white and green) brings out the theme of nature. There are small couches on the top floor, few benches here and there. I placed myself by one of the window seat. The counter to order our food is cute, as mentioned earlier little tropicana. From the cashier, to the barista girl, to my server...their services were friendly, helpful and very nice. I took a toast with avocado, chili flakes and smoked salmon. It was excellent. I also got a latte and chocolate pistachio croissant. It was decadent. I was at the café about three hours, working on my project. It was nice; the background was music was good. They also have free WIFI, and you will find password written everywhere. Before leaving, I took a chai latte for take out. Delicious! Will definitely be back.

I've heard great things about Tommy, so I visited it on a Friday evening with my girlfriend. If you're looking for a nice little café, there's a lot of those in Montreal. Like Crew Collective and Café, Tommy offers that quaint café experience in a historic building.It's a cute little establishment, with mirrored walls and small tables and window facing seating. It's quite small, so it's not ideal for large groups, but you can find seating if you're 1-3. I ordered a macchiato, and it was delicious as expected. If I lived closer, this might just be my new coffee stop. Can't wait to come back and try their avocado toast with an egg!
Such a pretty room. Walking distance to the cathedral (worth the $8us they charge). Great matcha latte. Great bagel with lox. Would reccomend for a good Breakfast/brunch experience in Old Montreal.

Great little cafe for salads and sandwiches on beautiful croissants. The BLT with white cheddar was light, and perfect for a late afternoon snack. Try the Jardin d'Eden, with lovely spirals of unusual radish, perfectly seasoned lettuces, edamame, avocat, and fromage de chèvre with red onion. Both are enough to share if dinner is a few hours away. Tommy is open all day, while many others in the area open only for dinner.

There's hype around it for a reason - super cute place, decor is on point. Good place to study as well, but sometimes it might get too busy or loud on weekends. Service is great too, the baristas are nice and helpful. Only issue is it's a bit too pricey: one slice of regular avocado toast is $9 before taxes and add ons (tomatoes, egg, smoked salmon) range from $1-$5 extra. A filter coffee is only $2.50 before tax, but it's very small. Definitely drop by for a coffee if you're in the area (or a student looking for a change of scenery from the library), but pack your own snacks or eat before coming.

Located at the edge of Old Montreal, it's a small, picturesque place. They had a good assortment of sweets. I tried their matcha latte, brioche, and Nutella cronut.The pastries seem to be store-bought, at least the brioche is as I've seen the exact same thing at another place. Regardless it was good, same for the cronut. Matcha latte was good too, I'd order it again! They make it fresh with matcha powder on the spot. Their prices are definitely not cheap, but affordable for occasional outings.Super cute, cozy comfortable environment, friendly service.

Beware!   Scammed because of the dollar exchange rate.  Lunch for two, was good, nice table by the open window to see into street.  Bill came to $66+ dollars,  when I paid with American money $70. Sorry we don't do exchange.   Over paid by $15+  Should have taken the time to do the math but was in a hurry.Must hate tourist!

I love this little shop. The decor is gorgeous and the service was prompt, friendly and welcoming. I ordered an egg sandwich and was informed they were out of prosciutto so would be replacing it with other ingredients which turned out to be totally fine and lol I don't even know what they replaced it with but it  was all delicious. I also ordered a chai latter and YUM. It's such a cute place to sit, drink, eat and read or do work. I would love to return here.

My friends and I stopped here right before we left the city and oh my. We are all so happy we did. The ambiance and aesthetics of the place were incomparable. I ordered an iced vanilla chai latte and a piece of avocado toast. My friend ordered an iced latte and a chocolate croissant. The girl working at the register was as nice and accommodating as can be. All food and drinks came out very quickly and were SO delicious. My friend and I agreed that her latte was beyond delicious, and I am still dreaming of my iced chai. Everything was so good. Had a great experience.
I love to seek out local coffee shops when traveling and Tommy did not disappoint! The place could not have been cuter and the coffee was fantastic. I had a maple iced latte.

Great way to start the day! Food was good. The decor is relaxing, pretty and green. It's a great corner location, right next to a church. You order at the counter then pick up your drink. Your sandwich/breakfast will be delivered to your table. Great location to relax or meet friends. I had the avocado Croissant sandwich with procuitto and egg. DELICIOUS. I would definitely get again. Must be able to walk up stairs to enter the restaurant and then to seating.

This location is best for grab and go or a causal coffee chat. Quaint and pleasant atmosphere. Delicious croissants, wow! The inside of it was coated with chocolate but it wasn't overwhelming and gooey or anything. So good. I also got the salmon lox - solid!

This place is am absolute jem! It is located right next to the Cathedral and it is an absolutely  gorgeous building. Once you come inside the devour is super cute! It is a mix of old a new. More importantly when we came in the girl at the counter was very friendly and helpful, very pleasant even before I had my coffee in me (When I am not at my best). I ordered avocado toast (yes basic white girl I know) and a croissant; they were both delicious!!! The prices here are very reasonable for what you get! I definatly recommend this place to everyone who comes in the area!

Overall it was a good experience. They didn't have the full menu so we had to the spicy tuna and the Nutella waffle toast thing. Only reason why this isn't 5 stars is because the space is way to small for the place. They should at least take up part of the side walk or the side street next door so more people are able to sit down. The prices were a bit much for Montreal standards but overall I would go back if I had the opportunity.

The bathroom situation needs improvement. No hand paper to dry your hands or air dryer in the sink area.No toilet paper in the actual bathroom but they did have hand paper INSTEAD. The barista wasn't welcoming at all.

Loved this place! I came here two times while in Montreal as it was close to my hotel. I absolutely loved the ambiance and the coffee they serve. The avocado toast and the grilled cheese sandwich are also a must if you're into more than a coffee for breakfast. The price point for the food is exceptional; you can't even get a cappuccino back in New York for what I paid for a whole breakfast here. If you're nearby, GO! It'd totally worth it. Also, the fact that I could only hear French being spoken around me made me realize locals also love and come to this place. Shoutout to the great staff! Keep it up guys!

If you're looking for a hip place pour une cafe, this is your place. And if you love plants and gawdy moldings. Though, If you're older than 30 and want breakfast, I would skip it. Most tables were full of 20-somethings sitting on laptops with a coffee. No place to sit and enjoy breakfast with a companion. We had the breakfast sandwich and avotoast. Both were good. Not amazing or worth a revisit.
Did not enjoy a simple bagel from here, took much too long just for a bagel with butter and service is very slow.
Great location, nice vibe, comfortable but can crowded.. fairly Limited menu. Had the avocado toast with prosciutto and it was divine. They make a mean cappuccino too!

This place is awesome!*The Coffee a tasty*The space engaging, decorated, and unique, clean(checkout the marble surfboard on the top floor!)*The staff friendly and genuine*The music(when I was there) was a mix of slightly off the beaten hip-hop and trapy rnb I co-worked with friends for a good couple of hours and it was time well spent. Really couldn't ask for anything more tbh

Food: 3/5Service: 3.5/5Atmosphere: 4/5Cleanliness: 3.5/5Price: $Montreal has one of the best cafe scenes in North America in my humble opinion. The island city (yes, Montreal is an island - bet you didn't know that!) always has new cafes sprouting up, and when Tommy Cafe first opened a few years back, it definitely became one of my favourite spots in Old Montreal.Hubby and I visited the cafe during date night before heading over for dinner at Bonaparte a few blocks down. You can read my review on their tasting menu here. Anyway, Tommy Cafe is in a historical building, so it has many features of the old classical architecture left which gives it a lot of character.What took my heart away was the ceiling.Definitely one of the hottest instagram-worthy spots in the cafe! With classical architecture, hip interior decor, and fresh plants hanging off the ceiling, there wasn't anything that I didn't like about the cafe!Onto the important stuff: the caffeinated drinks and food.The coffee was okay- to be honest, nothing too extraordinarily good or special that left hubby or me wanting to come back for more. The cafe itself was very nice and its vibes drew us to the cafe more so than the coffee. Though we didn't have food at Tommy Cafe that day, I went back by myself on another occasion to get some work done and I ordered a sandwich to try with my coffee. I had lunch here that day.First, I found the sandwich to be a little oily but that was okay-I didn't mind too much. Again, the food wasn't anything fancy or special... it was a pretty plain sandwich that met my hunger needs. I definitely recommend the coffee more than the food at Tommy Cafe.Though Tommy Cafe has a killer vibe, being in a historic building and all, the actual coffee and food can use some improvement. Tommy Cafe is a nice cafe to stop by to get some work done, to grab a bite to eat, or for catching up with a friend. It's definitely a great place to stop by if you're touring Old Montreal, but it isn't the best place to come for the 'best' coffee in the city, so if you're a coffee drinker that takes coffee pretty seriously, this place will probably wouldn't please you the most in that department. I'd still come to get my daily fix of caffeine and take a nice Instagram picture though.

I died and went to heaven when I walked into this beautiful cafe!I was in Canada for the extended holiday weekend and as we're walking around the streets of Montreal, I found this beauty. Stunning is all I can say. The decor was magnificent! My rating is only on the decor. Unfortunately, we were in such a rush I wasn't able to try the coffee or sit down. I wish this was in NY. I'd love to come back again.

Went with 2 friends around 4:30 for a quick bite. Got the avocado toast with onions and tomatoes. I have to say it is one of the best avo toast dishes I've ever tasted. The quality of the bread was noticeable and everything was made with care. It was a little challenging finding a place to sit but someone got up before too long and we got a seat. Lots of people (parties of 1) on their laptops sitting at tables for two looking as if they are settled in for the duration.

It's a nice coffee shop in downtown montreal next to the iconic notre dame church. Coffee is a bit strong to my taste, they also have a selection of pastries. I like their mezzanine, as well as the pending plants coming down from the ceiling , and the wooden stairs.

Our food guide told us about this place, so we decided to check it out for breakfast during our visit. While it's beautiful with all the hanging plants, the place was a total cluster. There was really no space for the line at the counter, which snaked up the stairs (too cold to spread out the door). They were out of bagels when it got to my turn to order so just got two cronuts and two coffees. The coffees were kind of weak, and like previous reviewers said were served in glass cups filled to the brim, and perhaps to make them easier to carry, the coffees were not very hot. The cronuts were nothing special, they were more like strangely shaped donuts than legit cronuts. Yawn.

This is probably one of the best coffee houses I've been to. I'm from Toronto and just like Montreal, Toronto has an abundance of coffee shops. I personally would rate this coffee shop higher than most in Toronto. I ordered the smoked salmon on sesame bagel and a cortado. The smoked salmon bagel was the best I've had and the reason was, aside from the freshness of the smoked salmon was simply the Montreal style bagel. Everyone knows how amazing Montreal bagels are and if you put smoked salmon in it, . The cortado was as good as it gets. My girlfriend got the avocado toast and cubano. The avocado toast came with an egg on top and it was delicious. My girlfriend and I both agreed that it was one of our favorites. The cubano was bitter and strong, just how I like my espresso. Overall, I would definitely visit this coffee house again whenever I am back in the city.

Cafe Tommy is a lovely cafe with great drinks and food in Old Port. I would recommend going on the WEEKDAYS because on the weekends it becomes the hunger games of trying to get a seat. Perfect if you are into people watching basic girls walk in and out trying to find a "cute place to study" in old port where they can take their snapchats but also plug into an outlet. As a study cafe, I would say Tommy can be a bit loud. The wifi here is UNRELIABLE and extremely slow so if you are bringing work, make sure you can get by without it. The best times to come are in the afternoon where you can take advantage of the amazing light that streams in through the windows. The space is undoubtedly gorgeous. the planters hanging from the ceiling and the decor make it feel like your cool aunt's workshop/lounge. Even though it's small, it is still one of the largest cafes in old port.

I used to like this place a lot. The last time when I visited here, i had 3 allongé because the espresso was so good. However I visited here on a Saturday afternoon. I had an allongé and my friend had a matcha latte.My allongé lost its charm and my friend's matcha latte tastes like hot milk. The environment is still 5/5 for being so beautiful. But with the inconsistent drink quality, I would call here a tourist attraction rather than a coffee shop.

The aesthetic of this place was amazing the big mirrors gave the appearance more room and the plants hanging from the ceiling gave a very down to earth grounded vibe. The coffee was a little pricey but was made fast and tasted great. The seating was very comfortable  but it was a bit busy so it was a little harder to find seating. This place is perfect for Instagram  would definitely recommend
Good food...nothing unique or spectacular. Tourist prices. Cute quirky ambience. You order from the counter and they bring the food to your table.
Wet mushy croissant. Yuck.And takes about 20 minutes to get one sandwich. I'm giving an extra star for cool atmosphere

Customer service is key with any business. The staff at Cafe Tommy have proven to be careless based on experiences of myself and friends. It is not enough to have a well decorated space with IG appeal. There is only one Batista who makes proper coffee and is kind. The others are unapologetic, gossip behind the counter and require basic customer training. In the photos, I've shared an example of this disrespect Cafe Tommy showed via social media to a friend of a friend. I have never been compelled to write such a review for any business. However, I don't support this attitude. Especially when my drink costs almost $5. But more than this, because the attitude reflects the management's mentality. Dear Cafe Tommy, You won't survive without customers. #NoAssholeRule

Chrissy is fantastic, she was very helpful and soooo funny. This cafe is amazing and much better than Starbucks. We will be back here for sure. Great ambiance and a lot of young people. Love it. 5 stars.

I found this place to be overhyped. Not quite as amazing as everyone says, but definitely a place to get a solid coffee and take some pretty social media pics.It is decorated nicely in the hipster modern whatever with marble, white, hanging plants, etc. Warning - this place is actually quite small. That is a big mirror over there on the wall. So before you walk into the mirror thinking you will go sit far from the door, think again. Typical trick to make a space seem bigger and brighter. It works. It looks HUGE in here. Just don't get confused...Caffeinated drink I had was good. You can get alcohol here too if you want. Service typical of Montreal - adequate, never that friendly. If you ask them a question, their response is like it took a lot of effort to reply.

First off, the decor, vibe and ambience of this cafe are so nice. Lots of plants, light colours, just a very overall calming and open aesthetic. We had looked at the menu beforehand to see if there were any vegan breakfast options, and it looked like the had an acai bowl and avocado toast. However when we ordered apparently the acai bowl was only served at another location and somehow they were already out of avocado. The lady behind the counter was very nice though, and when we asked if there was anything else vegan she pulled out some vegan banana bread that ended up being really hearty and delicious. I also got a matcha latte and it was great.

Cute small Cafe near the Notre-Dame Basilica of Montreal. Their coffee is great and the food as well. Only thing I didn't like that much was the fact you had to carry your own drinks to the table and sometimes it's a very heavy cup to the upper floor.

This cafe was so cute! The interior is designed so beautifully with seems like 3 floors. There is free wifi and restrooms. The drinks are really good and I'm impressed with the artistic skills making the latte art, especially since both drinks were made with non-dairy milk! I do wish the size of the drink was larger like in a round mug. Their pastries also all looked delicious! I got the chocolate croissant and chocolate chip cookie. Definitely recommend the croissant!
Some of the best coffee I've had in Montreal! Such a great French bistro vibe with great lounge areas! Food was superb

Great coffee and amazing toasts and sandwiches. I got coffee here 3 days out of my five day trip to Montréal and at lunch on my last day. This is the best coffee shop in the area and the avocado toast was the perfect breakfast! Will definitely return if I'm ever in Montréal again!
Nice environment and cozy. The matcha latte is good. It's perfect for reading a book or chit chatting with your friend. Love the cute decoration

It is a cool spot to grab a coffee. Although it wasn't any out of the ordinary coffee the ambiance makes up for it. Also it is self service, just in case you're looking for something different. I ordered a matcha latte, it was good, very "instagramable" but nothing I would crave to try again.
Such a cute cafe! The price is okay but the environment of the cafe is the reason I went! A lot of green vines around. Very aesthetic

Their decor is one of the main features, it's very pretty inside. The place is popular spot for getting your morning coffee and pastry. It is a little bit more pricey compared to other coffee places, but the coffee I got was good so it's definitely worth a visit. The service could be improved, that being said, I'd put it on the list of cool coffee places to check out in Old Montreal area.

Oh, Montreal!  You're making it harder and harder for me to name my favourite café here in town!  This is now my faaaaavvvveeee café ever!  Come alone, or come with a gf, or even bring a date!  Just walking to the door will put a smile on your face.  During warmer months, there are pillows on the steps for you to sit and just people watch.  Grab a seat inside instead and just bask in the glories of this place.  There is a balcony, or mezzanine like, floor as well, and that's where the washrooms are. So funky, so fresh, just simply welcoming.No filtered iced coffee, but have tried their iced americano, and a donut topped with nutella.  The americana was on point and refreshing.  I shared the donut, but should have gotten 1 each ;).There is wifi, and when I came here on St Jean Baptist holiday (June 24, 2017), there was an English sign that said "All you can drink mimosas for $25"!Each seat throughout the place really gives you a good vantage point of all the details that makes this place so unique.  There really is so much character. If posting pics is what you like to do with your hot beverage, then grab a pen or Sharpie and fill in the blank on your stamped cup - sometimes there's a box for you to write in it ;).

I went to Café Tommy twice for breakfast while I was in town a few weeks ago, as it was just a block away from my rental apartment. The decor is Instagram worthy. The hot tea came in a large mug with your own teapot, which I much prefer to having to keep asking for hot water refills. The quiche was more crust than eggs and fillings, but still delicious. The first floor can be a bit drafty of if they are busy but they have a second floor (where the small bathrooms are located). Unlike other reviewers, I found the staff nothing but pleasant and helpful to a tourist.

Such a cool atmosphere! The decor and overall comfort of this place is unmatched. I could have sat there for hours. The pastries are like eye candy and taste even better. The service is optimal and even a long line will move quickly. The only downfall, as with most popular cafes in Old Port, is finding a place to sit without people breathing down your neck. But the food, service and atmosphere make it worth it.
Great local vibe that's abounding with personality. Coffee is great and strong. Enjoy the music, coffee and social environment.

Finally made it to Tommy cafe after all this time...I'd heard about it from a friend of mine whose name is actually Tommy, lol.The place has a lot of character, very hipster, come have a drink lounge around for a bit, read or browse on your device, they have free wifi.I had an avocado toast with egg on top. It was delicious, they had some hot pepper flakes in it which gave it a nice kick.Their chai latte is excellent. Love this place, it's peaceful and cute, just like my friend Tommy :)

Situated in a historical building (British Empire Building in old Montreal) Tommy cafe looks very appealing.The cafe presents coffee classics such as croissants, sandwiches, juices and of course different types of coffees.I personally tried a large Cappuccino presented Italian style in a glass which I found really nice. Good coffee, perfect milk combination.My 11 year old son tried a beautiful French croissant that he found was good, not too crusty, not too soft. He also tried a Dose fruit juice named "Zest" - of course he enjoyed that.The setting is a mix of a European look with a kind of madman touch - the mix works.So all in all, Tommy Cafe doesn't reinvent the cafe, but does make it very appealing.

Our family stopped in despite seeing other options. We were very happy we opted for this dining spot! My Greek Avotoast and mimosa were beyond delish. My husband loved his smoked salmon bagel, and we all enjoyed our son's French toast waffle with fresh berries and cream. Fantastic brunch!!!

I've been waiting to check off this stop on my coffee crawl for a while now, so I'm super exited to have finally gone to this insta-famous location. I went with a friend on a Saturday afternoon; it was pretty crowded, but we still found a table upstairs. The cafe has good lighting and overall amazing decoration - a nice reading or light studying place with outlets available and diverse seating (there were couches upstairs too). When we were ordering, one of the staff brought out a plate of discounted pastries, so I got a 40% off croissant. Would not recommend: it tasted like a 40% off croissant. I got an iced latte, which was amazing, and my friend's iced matcha was less sweet than I expected, which was nice since I usually don't like sweet drinks. Overall, nice drinks, nicer ambience. If you're looking for the wifi password, look on the cute little blackboard signs!

On a snowy Thursday, I stayed here for 3 or 4 hours to read. The prices are definitely on the higher side - a sandwich costs $10, a quiche $5.75 - but it has a really comfortable vibe with music that is at just the right volume so its not oppressive. There is some serious competition for the booths and window seats, you might have to wait a couple hours for people to leave, and the seating is not all that plentiful. People seem to camp here for the day. My espresso was sharp and flavorful, not the best I've had, but certainly up there. My girlfriend had an 8/10 regular coffee and she can be picky about her caffeine consumption.

Tommy is a very cute coffee shop! Be careful the steps going up to Tommy are pretty steep but once you pass that your next challenge is to find a place to sit. It was a cold day so we went in to get a drink but had to get it to go. There was no spots free (even upstairs), I don't blame the customer it is very warm and cozy. They have a good selection of food and bake goods (a bit pricy). But we only ordered a Hot Chocolate and Chai Latte. The hot chocolate was bold like dark chocolate but with the warm milk it was well balanced. The Chai latte on the other hand taste like cane sugar and warm milk and had no Chai tea flavour or spice to it, but it was warm =) Maybe it was an off day for the Chai Latte.

Very cute cafe in Old Port! There is background noise but it's not too loud so it's a good place to do work or sit down and chat. They also have super tasty breakfast menus and pastries, but the price is a little more expensive than a usual cafe. Also, beware if you're going on a weekend because it's a small space and can get really busy. I still come here regularly and I love the nice atmosphere, music and design but the business&price is something you could look out for!

Really cute place to grab a coffee, sit for a few minutes while exploring Old Montréal and take a couple #instagramworthy photos. The atmosphere is very bright and fresh. The baristas were super friendly and quick. The seating area was tight when we arrived around 2-3 pm but if you can't find a spot inside, the front steps are pretty wide and a great place to plop down for a minute. I got an Iced Americano and it was super yummy. It's a really fun place to stop by if you're in the neighbourhood and need a little caffeine boost.
Amazing location. Amazing prices compared to other coffee shops around the basilica. The most inviting garden-like atmosphere. And very friendly accommodating staff. Excellent all around.

The atmosphere here is amazing, especially on a cold morning. The interior is cute, vintage, and cozy. I had their black coffee. It was hot though a little bit too burnt for my taste. The croissant was airy, buttery, and flaky. It's probably one of my favorite croissants I have had. My friend had pecan pie. It was too sweet; the pie itself was mediocre. I would still recommend Tommy regardless for the ambience.

Worst Worst service possible. They didn't let my family enter and lied saying kitchen was full although there were plenty of seats. The group right behind us seated after they refused us. They are racists.

chic place - looks like a pinterest room food is nicely platted but also tastes great only complaint would be the difficulty in finding spotswould be good place for casual breakfast /lunch / afternoon coffee break

Tommy, located in the expensive and often tourist trap filled Old Port, surprised me with its' stellar service, affordable menu, and very good food. The interior is fantastically decorated and with windows the open to the street it's perfect for people watching. I only tried one light dish (a smoothie bowl very elegantly served) and although I enjoyed it, I can't say it was fantastic. What makes Tommy worth the visit is the amazing service and charming interior.

What a cafe should be! They got all the aspects right.- The decor is very inspired - taking an old space and making it an inventive multi level space. You have space on your own, space to share with friends, sofa of chairs.- The service is smiling - they do! they are helpful, nice, and their happiness makes the experience perfect.- The coffee and pastries are on point - good selection, and well made coffee.Was worried it would be a tourist trap so close to the Old town and the Cathedral, and it's actually a very nice place to be and spend time - some people are working, but other are just chatting and having a good time, an atmosphere a cafe should create and Tommy aces it.

Love this place! Their crounuts is amazing! It's nice to come and do study, meet up friends and quick take out. Their decoration is so cute and clean. They are always busy but still give food and drink without delay and mistakes! Been this place since they opened and never made a mistake on my order despite how crazy busy it can be! Tastes A+. Cleanness A+. Friendly A+. Overall, A+++++

I stopped here for coffee and a place to relax and wasn't disappointed at all.The latte was delicious and well-made, and the service was very friendly. If you're looking for a full breakfast menu, I wouldn't suggest this cafe, but would recommend for a pastry and cup of coffee.

Confession: yes I did come here after seeing pictures of the beautiful interior on Instagram. yes I have was super basic and ordered a cronut and chai latte...Tommy is cozy with a beautiful aesthetic. Their drinks and food are pricey, but it's vibe and location in Old Montreal (not to mention free wifi) make it a great cafe. The cronut is a bit sweeter than those in New York but the texture is pretty on point.
Best music! Tall ceilings and tall windows and plants hanging from cooking !! Coolest space

This place is so lovely! We saw it after close on our walk around Norte-Dame yesterday, and just had to come back today. The greenery hanging from he ceiling is magical and there's lots of cozy seating and tables although it was pretty much constantly full. There's glasses and glass water bottles on some of the tables which is very nice, especially if you're sitting upstairs. The lighting is lovely, all coffee drinks imbibed did not disappoint, and the almond croissant was delicious. The avocado toast was sublime and the soup of the day was carrot and potato, also amazing. Do yourself a favor and stop by, maybe even stay a while, we certainly did!

What a nice little coffee spot! The interior is beautiful with crown molding and very rustic chiq. The tomato bisque soup, quinoa salad, grilled cheese are tasty! Most of all I love the assortment of pastries- the Nutella cronut is delicious! Came back daily many mornings during my Montreal stay!

This is my favourite cafe by far! I'll be coming back as a regular for sure. It's a pretty recent location that opened only two years ago. I am a very health-conscious eater and was pleased with their selections on their menu! First time around, I ordered a multigrain toast topped with an avocado spread and topped with cayenne pepper flakes. It was simply delicious! I really adored everything about this place; the interior layout, decor, food, service, lighting, coffee and their music most of all. Really good selection in music. Definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a cafe to work from or simply grab coffee or lunch with a friend.

Super cute cafe located in Old Montreal district, very close to the Notre-Dame Basilica. I loved this place's historical architecture. It is a great place for brunch. I recommend their avocado toast and matcha rose latte.

We ordered the breakfast sandwich of the day, salmon bagel and two chocolate croissants. We washed it all down with a couple of hot chocolate, a mocha, and a cappuccino. Great breakfast in a beautiful spot. Free Wi-Fi to plan the rest of our day was a plus.
